snippet: The prime minister broke with political tradition by formally opening the campaign in the middle of summer during what is a holiday weekend in most of the country.
abstract: Canadian Prime Min Stephen Harper formally opens campaign period ahead of October elections, setting up longest campaign period since Canadians began voting on same day in 1974; move appears aimed at giving campaign funding edge to Harper's Conservative party, which has come under fire for ethics violations and struggling economy.
lead_paragraph: The prime minister broke with political tradition by formally opening the campaign in the middle of summer during what is a holiday weekend in most of the country.

headline.main: Stephen Harper of Canada, Hoping to Extend Conservatives’ Hold, Calls Elections
headline.print_headline: Canadian Premier, Hoping to Extend Hold, Calls Elections Early
